name: Dreams Riviera Cancun Resort & Spa

reviews.text: Just returned from our second visit to Dreams Riviera (don't confuse with Dreams Cancun) and it delivered again.
reviews.title: You really can't fault the VFM

reviews.text: I don't understand the negative reviews, and can only assume they are from people who just like to complain for the sake of complaining.
reviews.title: I had high hopes

reviews.text: Everything about this place is outstanding for a 5* relaxing and entertaining holiday for families or groups of friends. The staff wait on you all day as you lounge around the pool or on the beach, with no complaints at all. We take £200 for tips as these people work so hard to make your holiday as relaxing as possible. David the waiter by the pool / beach and Vanessa in the reception / lounge area are superb and very friendly!
reviews.title: hotel no wow factor

reviews.text: The rooms are superb, and for any of you thinking of booking a plunge pool for either yourselves or children you can make a decent saving by booking when you get there for around $40/night which is a decent saving against the £600/week quoted on booking at home.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Food, And Staff

reviews.text: Facilities are top notch with the food being served often exceeding many decent restaurants we have visited, particularly the Japanese restaurant Himitsu and recommend booking the Tepenyaki table at 5pm for a night.
reviews.title: Fantastic family holiday.

reviews.text: We had been to Dreams Tulum 2 years previous and thought it was an amazing holiday and resort, so when my bro said he was getting married at this resort we jumped at it.
reviews.title: Only 1 thing I can say "Salmonella"

reviews.text: I wish we hadn't to be honest, in the first week my son got an ear infection from the pool, we know it's from the pool because the on-site doctor told us he was the 4th kid that week with an ear infection and it was from the pool.
reviews.title: Nice,cozy, not big, not crowded, place to relax, ocean front

reviews.text: Then exactly half way through our 2 week holiday my wife and I fell ill, basically the second week was spent in the room.
reviews.title: First-rate All-inclusive

reviews.text: When we got home and went to the doctors, they ran tests and it was CONFIRMED we had Salmonella (which we still have 6 weeks later)
reviews.title: Excellent resort, Great vacation

reviews.text: We have contacted the powers that be and have basically been told to prove we got it there.
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.text: I'm going to try to keep this from being long winded. We have travelled extensively in the Riviera Maya and its not always possible to find a resort that can 100% satisfy. Dreams met 75% of our needs. We just returned from a week with our in-laws and 6 & 8yr old girls.
reviews.title: Mostly solid resort

reviews.text: We stayed in a Preferred ocean view plunge room which was wonderful when you wanted a break from the busy pool area.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with a touch of luxury

reviews.text: Pools-If you wanted prime seats by the infinity pool you definitely needed to be up and out there by 7. My mother in law or I would get up and have coffee early poolside-very peaceful and worth the gorgeous front row views. Pool was great but seemed a tad small for the hotel capacity/size. My biggest complaint as well as my entire party was lack of music/activity poolside. You may hear a solid 30min of music a day. It really livened up the atmosphere. My 61 year old father in law and I actually approached the "DJ" and said "is it possible to play music". His reply was "some people complain if its too loud and just want to relax". He did play a few additional songs. Down 2 resorts at Now Sapphire (part of AM resorts) music is played non-stop. The entertainment staff did not interact with guests. Most resorts they come around and let you know when activities were to begin. Not once did I see a single staff come by the infinity pool to engage the guests.
reviews.title: Always a good day at Dreams

reviews.text: Drink service was great around the pool/beach
reviews.title: Extraordinarily and pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: Beach- pretty but heavy on sea grass and trash washing up, very warm. My daughter got bit by a jelly fish our first day. The lifeguard had vinegar which helped out a lot! The beach bar was great! So comfy to swing in the breeze. The bartenders were fantastic and always remembered your drink :). If the beach bar was utilized for an evening party that would be a big hit.
reviews.title: Second time and just as good.
Impressive resort with some shortcomings
reviews.text: This resort was overall really beautiful and offered a lot of services. We were genuinely impressed but had some disappointments. We travelled here in august for a week with 2 small children and had a ocean view room on the 4th floor.

reviews.title: Great All-Inclusive For The Family
reviews.text: Pros:

reviews.title: Our honeymoon trip
reviews.text: FOOD. So much food. You won't starve. No reservations for restaurants. Can go to restaurants as many times as you like.

reviews.title: Hit & Miss Service - Overall Poor
reviews.text: HOUSEKEEPING: lovely. I wish I recalled our housekeeper's name as she was really great. The rooms are kept so clean and the turn down service is really good. Fresh towels, garbages emptied twice a day if you need it. The only downside is at first the housekeeper was coming before lunch and somehow near the end of our stay was trying to come during our kids' nap and we had to ask them to come back later.

reviews.title: "Follow the Leader, Leader, Leader!! Follow the Leader.." to this place!!
reviews.text: COCO CAFE: Imagine walking in to starbucks and ordering coffees and desserts and walking out without paying every day! This was our coup de coeur at Dreams! And the girls working there were so sweet.

All staff was all amazing, couldn't of chosen a better resort in that area every body was so friendly and welcoming, "Levent; who's apart of the entertainment team was alway there full of fun and making my family all laugh!
reviews.title: Fantastic would definitely return!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ad a Great trip to Mexico recently for our honeymoon and we found dreams to be exactly what we were looking for it seams to be built more for couples rather than families and they seem not to like children
reviews.title: Fantastic venue just to do nothing

reviews.text: eg when we were standing waiting to have dinner next to the pool the staff would not let children in to have there dinner next to he pool because they had swim wear on. What sense does this make? Over all I didn't find the staff very nice and always doing things like above.
reviews.title: A little bit of everything!!

reviews.text: But besides the staff the venue is great a good couple and family atmosphere between guests. And the beach is great lots to do and nice to walk up and very safe.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this resort back in june from the 25th to the third of july and i have been meaning to write this review for a while. It is very hard to find anything bad to say about this place because it's honestly as close to paradise as it gets. There are always things going on from the nightly/daily shows to the activities that go on during the day that there is never a dull moment; even if you're just laying out getting a tan, its just a beautiful place to be. Even the staff, everyone there is so friendly and i have to give like the biggest shoutouts to Mauricio and to Levent because they were both so much fun to be around and whether I was playing water or beach volleyball with Levent or talking with Mauricio or all of the other people I was fortunate enough to meet, they really just made the vacation a great experience.
reviews.title: Gorgeous resort

reviews.text: This resort deserves a 5 star rating. I have to admit that I was a little skeptic after reading some of the reviews on this hotel before I left but let me tell you this resort is WOW!!! My family enjoyed themselves, 2 daughters ages 7 & 5 had a blast. We met 2 other family friends and they would 100% agree with me that this resort was amazing. The room, food, entertainment - excellent. Even when the air condition was out for a night, they apologized for the inconvenience but ensured us that it was being fixed, thank goodness the breeze at night was refreshing. The only annoying aspect of this trip were the mosquitos and sand flies. OFF spray, skin so soft AVON, does not work, these blood suckers are hungry.
reviews.title: Outstanding!!

reviews.text: Your oceanfront view room is positioned so that when you wake up in the morning you will see the sun rise, so the bed is facing the balcony on an angle. The bed backs onto a double sink. and the shower (huge) and toilet have separate glass doors. The rooms are clean and there is someone always cleaning, fixing or just making sure you are comfortable.
reviews.title: Many thanks again 3'rd time

reviews.text: One good thing about this resort is that you do not have those wristbands you wear the whole trip and you don't have to make reservations to eat. Lucky for us we did not have to wait long because we were there in low season but you are not obligated to show up for a reservation which was nice. All there restaurants were spectacular and we did not have any stomach issues. You need to just watch out for the birds and make sure you don't get extra poop spice in your lunch or dinner because that might make you sick. When you go try all the restaurants, I felt like I ate gourmet each and every night.
reviews.title: Out Of This World

reviews.text: As for the pool, tell me which resort can actually stop you from reserving your prime spot for the day? There were security guards actually taking towels off the chairs but it does state that there are no reserving of seats, so this hotel really tries to keep ALL their vacationers very happy.
reviews.title: Amazing!!!

reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this resort and also come back next year. I got a great tan and gained 5 lbs. .....so that has to tell you that it was an OUTSTANDING vacation. Have fun and enjoy your stay!!!
reviews.title: Dreamy

reviews.text: We were a little sceptical of this hotel due to a last minute change from 'The Royal' due to building work & also reading some negative reviews on here before hand. I am so glad to say that there was no need to worry as Dreams Riveria was amazing! After a very long flight, we were greeted with bubbly & check in was quick and efficient! Room was fabulous-well equipped & huge bed! Mini bar well stocked with drinks! It would have been nice to have snacks as others have suggested mind! I'm going to try not to write too much- restaurants were beautiful, not a bad meal in one! Asian was our favourite! Bars were fabulous & service was second to none, although we tipped everyone! The staff work so hard & so long & deserve their tips especially being spoken to by some guests not from the UK!
reviews.title: A Dream honeymoon!

reviews.text: Negatives-
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.text: -It would have been nice to have an adults only pool but it is a family friendly resort.
reviews.title: Dream of a vacation

reviews.text: -Wifi is a joke! You shouldn't have to pay for it!! We did one day for Internet banking & after 5hours my time was up! I went to reception 3 times with the same cutting us off problem & eventually it worked for the remainder of the day. On check out they tried to charge me for 2 days!! No way I was paying! Was sorted quickly in fairness!
reviews.title: Girls getaway

reviews.text: - the long trousers for men was a pain! Luckily we had read up about this before we went so my husband packed a few pairs. I just found this unfair when I could wear short summer dresses to stay cool & hubby always warm in shirts & trousers!
reviews.title: Fabulous Family Friendly Resort

reviews.text: Bad location but great for couples not really much to do for children if they don't go the kids club to isolated need free transport to cancun if your there for two weeks the entertainment staff are really good had great fun with them water volley ball an other activities levent an the other entertainment staff are really helpfull xxx
reviews.title: Dreams riviera cancun hotel !!! X

reviews.text: My husband and I were married on 7-17-12, and we had an amazing experience! We had 21 guests, and every one of them, including ourselves, were BEYOND impressed with this resort. From the time we arrived we were welcomed by friendly, welcoming staff, and that service continued throughout the week. We were beyond impressed with the service, esp. Antonio, our favorite server! By the end of the week,, he felt more like a part our group than a waiter we had just met. If I had to pick the 'best' thing about the resort, it would be the staff, as they go above and beyond to make your trip unforgettable. I had never been to Mexico or to an all-inclusive, so I was unsure what to expect. After this trip, I am afraid to try a different resort in fear of disappointment! The quality of the food and drinks was superb, and we enjoyed every single meal. I have a seafood allergy, and our chef and servers at Himitsu were very accommodating - very impressed with this careful attention. Portofino was also amazing, and Oceana was our favorite spot for lunch. As part of our wedding package, we enjoyed a private romantic dinner on the beach, and this was the best meal I have ever had (again, they adjusted my menu due to my seafood allergy). Prior to our arrival, I emailed the wedding staff via email, and although at times they were a bit slow in responding, I completely understood why once we arrived and met with Lorena, our coordinator. They are turning out multiple weddings EVERY day, and each was unique and beautiful. We essentially planned an entire wedding in about 20 minutes, 3 days before, and everything was exactly how I could have pictured it! Our private reception in the Wine Cellar was beyond my expectations! I would highly recommend this resort to anyone considering a destination wedding! We stayed in a preferred club, ocean view room, and I highly recommend the preferred club, as you have access to the private lounge, free wi-fi codes, and upgraded mini-bar. Our view was picture perfect, and we enjoyed the jacuzzi on the balcony as opposed to a plunge pool, which we also considered when we planned our trip. The spa is amazing, and our couples' massage was the best we've ever had. We can't wait to return to Dreams one day, and definitley recommend this resort!
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful destination wedding and vacation experience!

reviews.text: Travelled from 08/11/2012-08/18/2012. Family of 4 (2 boys under age 12)
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: This was an excellent choice. We were treated as VIP's from the moment we walked into the lobby. We knew there would be a wait to receive our room (check-in is at 3, as is common for resorts) but we were nonetheless offered refreshments and we were able to have lunch right away. The resort grounds are gorgeous and extremely well-kept and clean. Our bellboy, Antonio, was professional and very welcoming. He gave us a complete tour of our room - which we received earlier than we had anticipated. It is open concept. We had a premium deluxe room with a plunge pool on the balcony - absolutely worth it for us. The kids had a great time in there! Food was excellent in all of the restaurants. The French restaurant was no exception - just be aware that it is the only restaurant where children under 12 are not allowed. Not a problem, there is a kids' club of course. The beach was beautiful, although the hurricane that had passed through the week before did stir up some jellyfish to shore. The entire resort felt safe and secure - security posted on the beach as well. There is always at least one life guard patrolling the pool and beach areas.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: I had an incredible experience at the spa, which was like a separate piece of paradise altogether.
reviews.title: great holiday

description: The luxurious Dreams Riviera Cancun takes its personality from its incredible location — just 30 minutes from the "hot" excitement of Cancun yet right on the "cool" Caribbean close to Playa del Carmen and many other of the Mayan Riviera’s most sought after sights. Most importantly, it is an enchanting wonderland where families, couples, singles and friends enjoy all the pleasures and privileges of Unlimited-Luxury® where everything is included. Your whole being will relax immediately, surrounded by our large sun-dappled swimming pools and a sugar white sand beach. To this, add lush tropical gardens and of course, our fabulous palm-filled beach. Your day and evening activities range from exciting to purely relaxing — with plenty to do for everyone including endless land and water activities, a world-class Dreams Spa by Pevonia and fitness center, nearby golf and much more. "Home" features the uniquely shaped octagonal room or suite, beautifully appointed with a private balcony, marble floors and full marble bath area with Jacuzzi tub and dozens of other luxury amenities and conveniences that anticipate your desires and fulfill them instantly.
